FuncDef:
The vsm alarm cpu-performance threshold command configures an alarm threshold for CPU performance on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The undo vsm alarm cpu-performance threshold command restores the default alarm threshold for CPU performance on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The default alarm threshold is 80% for CPU performance on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.

ParaDef.Info:
Configures an alarm threshold for CPU performance.
The value is an integer ranging from 40 to 100, in percentage. The default value is 80%.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] undo vsm alarm cpu-performance log disable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure an alarm threshold for CPU performance on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S, run the vsm alarm cpu-performance threshold command. If CPU performance on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S reaches a configured alarm threshold, an alarm is generated. After CPU performance exceeds the alarm threshold, the alarm is not reported repeatedly. If CPU performance on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S falls below 87.5% of a configured alarm threshold, a clear alarm is generated.
Prerequisites
CPU performance log or trap monitoring has been enabled using the undo vsm alarm cpu-performance disable command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
